title: Reflective Practice Workshop for University Curriculum Design

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental science knowledge and general understanding of curriculum design
context.additional_context: Distributed Learning Environment Using Smartphone-Based Collaborative Tools, with Continuous Feedback via Formative Assessment

learning_goals: Learners can explain the linkage between upper- and lower-level structures by analyzing actual university course design cases.
Learners can develop self-assessment tools by applying the Reflective Practice methodology.
Learners can establish a peer feedback system in a PBL environment and perform at least three design revision cycles.
Learners can produce at least two types of digital educational resources using smartphone-based tools.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
